Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: skew
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This allows you to apply a “skew” to the widget.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: onGradientEndColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The ending color. If not provided, then the starting color is used.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: onGradientAngleInDegrees
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The angle of the gradient, in degrees. 0 (default) is top-to-bottom.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: offGradientEndColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The ending color. If not provided, then the starting color is used.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: offGradientAngleInDegrees
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The angle of the gradient, in degrees. 0 (default) is top-to-bottom.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: hasLeadingZeroes
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This is true, if values are to be displayed with leading zeores.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: numberOfDigits
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This is the number of digits for this group. 0 (or less), means no display.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: gap
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This is how many calculation (not display) units separate each digit. Default is 8.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: onImage
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This property allows you to assign an image to the on segments.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: value
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This is a numerical value to set to the collected digits.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: minValue
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: Read-only value that returns the minimum possible value for this instance (always -2).

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: maxValue
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: Read-only value that returns the maximum possible value for this instance.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: idealAspect
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The ideal aspect ratio (X / Y) of the display.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: radix
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The numerical base of the display (2, 8, 10, 16). 16 is default.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: image
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This property allows you to assign an image to the off segments.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: layoutSubviews()
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: Called when the views are to be laid out. Most of the action happens here.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html.name: RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html.abstract: The display is a subclass of UIImageView. We do this, so we can easily have a background image.
